H0.text: What was the name given in England to the ringing, introduced by William the Conqueror, of a bell at sunset or 8pm in winter as a signal to extinguish fires and lights. Curfew Bell

H1.text: What was the name given in England to the ringing, introduced by William the Conqueror, of a bell at sunset or 8pm in winter as a signal to extinguish fires and lights. Vesper Signal

H2.text: What was the name given in England to the ringing, introduced by William the Conqueror, of a bell at sunset or 8pm in winter as a signal to extinguish fires and lights. Sunset Toll

H3.text: What was the name given in England to the ringing, introduced by William the Conqueror, of a bell at sunset or 8pm in winter as a signal to extinguish fires and lights. Kerfew

A4.text: Ruthin, Wales had a curfew bell at 8 p.m. to warn all citizens to be indoors at night.

A5.text: Coleraine in Ireland had a curfew bell at 8 p.m., after which all country-dwellers had to be outside the city walls.
